Author: TonyL#3577
Content: @Cryptonian txfee for BTC isn't hardcoded calculating dynamically from AtomicDEX protocol side, let me find out how it's calculating üòÉ

Author: TonyL#3577
Content: In general you'll see it before broadcasting confirmation, last time I've tried to send BTC fee was around 0.0005

Author: TonyL#3577
Content: https://github.com/KomodoPlatform/atomicDEX-API/blob/mm2/mm2src/coins/utxo.rs#L1681 for BTC it's calculating as "Dynamic" in case of electrum mode usage (which AtomicDEX is using), and this dynamic is taking from electrumx protocol if I understand correct. I think @artem.pikulin or @artemciy_dice can explain precise how this fee calculating

Author: Oszy#5734
Content: if funds are spent, does it cancel all orders automatically related to that coin?

Author: Oszy#5734
Content: or does it stay and will get executed when i have that coin again?

Author: TonyL#3577
Content: Like a case when you have KMD/RVN KMD/DOGE lets say and somebody sell you some DOGE and you don't have enough KMD to pay for KMD/RVN order?

Author: Oszy#5734
Content: yes

Author: Oszy#5734
Content: if  KMD balance goes to 0

Author: TonyL#3577
Content: I don't think that order will be cancelled automatically in such case - most probably second swap will just fail on maker txfee (in case of balance == 0) or maker payment tx broadcasting stage (in case if balance < maker payment)

Content: should it be removed tho?  is it going to make a difference in bigger scales for the mm2 if it's filled with many active orders that can't be filled because of this?

Author: Oszy#5734
Content: also to avoid failed swaps

Author: TonyL#3577
Content: It's better to ask in #dev-marketmaker , I'm not 100% sure on this part of protocol logic
